title: President calls on Tamil, Muslim MPs to back efforts to foster unity
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has urged Tamil and Muslim opposition parties to support the Government’s efforts to foster inter-community understanding and build a peaceful, inclusive Sri Lanka.

title: Brazil’s ex-president Bolsonaro detained by police ahead of vigil
byline: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro was taken into federal police custody on Saturday before a planned supporters’ vigil near his home, ending months of house arrest as he appeals a Supreme Court conviction for plotting a coup.

title: Six dead as rescue operations at Kadugannawa landslide site ends
byline: Police confirmed that rescue efforts at the Pahala Kadugannawa landslide site have now concluded, with six bodies recovered from the debris.

title: Yesterday’s rally not aimed at promoting Namal: Harin
byline: The joint opposition rally held at Nugegoda yesterday was not aimed at promoting Namal Rajapaksa but to take on the government, United National Party (UNP) Deputy General Secretary Harin Fernando told the media today.

title: Ganethenna landslide: Two more bodies recovered: Death toll climbs to four
byline: The death toll from the landslide at Pahala Kadugannawa rose to four after rescue teams recovered the bodies of two more victims, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said.

title: Head heroics power Australia past England in Ashes opener
byline: England went down to a crushing defeat in the first Ashes Test as Travis Head’s blistering century completed an astonishing Australia fightback in Perth.

title: UPDATE: Death toll rises to two in Ganethenna landslide
byline: The number of deaths from the landslide at Lower Kadugannawa in the Ganethenna area has increased to two, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) said today.

title: Rockfall closes Colombo–Kandy road, trapping several in Ganethenna
byline: A section of the Colombo–Kandy main road has been temporarily closed after a rockfall and earth movement struck a shop and a house in the Ganethenna area of Pahala Kadugannawa, leaving 10 people trapped inside.

title: Sri Lanka launches international workshop on national llan of action for small-scale fisheries
byline: Sri Lanka marked a significant step in sustainable fisheries management with the inauguration of the International Workshop on the National Plan of Action for Small-Scale Fisheries (NPOA-SSF), held yesterday (20) at the Lotus Tower in Colombo.

title: Opening of 9-arch bridge lighting project postponed indefinitely
byline: The Central Cultural Fund has announced that the opening of the 9 Arch Bridge lighting project in Demodara has been postponed indefinitely due to issues involving the installation of electricity cables through private land.

title: Electronic bus fare payment system to launch tomorrow
byline: The programme to introduce electronic card payments for bus travel will be officially launched from tomorrow(24) at the Makumbura Multimodal Transport Centre.

title: Cannabis cultivations unearthed inside Yala Sanctuary
byline: Three large-scale cannabis cultivations have been uncovered in the Gonagan Ara area of the Yala Sanctuary during a special four-day operation carried out by Police.

title: Sri Lanka launches international workshop on national plan of action for small-scale fisheries
byline: Sri Lanka marked a significant step in sustainable fisheries management with the inauguration of the International Workshop on the National Plan of Action for Small-Scale Fisheries (NPOA-SSF), held yesterday (20) at the Lotus Tower in Colombo.

title: Titanic couple’s pocket watch sells for record £1.78m
byline: The 18-carat Jules Jurgensen engraved watch was owned by first class passenger Isidor Straus, who died when the ship sank in April 1912.

title: Special message to A/L candidates affected by adverse weather
byline: The Department of Examinations informs candidates of the Advanced Level (A/L) examinations who are affected by the adverse whether conditions to contact the nearest Zonal Education office, the Department of Examinations or the Disaster Management Centre if they are unable to access even the alternative transport methods.

title: Minister vows legal action against those who removed directional signboards at archaeology sites in Batticaloa
byline: Claiming that a certain group has removed the directional signboards erected by the Archaeology Department to archaeology sites in the Batticaloa district, Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs Minister Hiniduma Sunil Senevi said that legal action will be taken against those involved in the act.

title: Groundbreaking for Jaffna’s first indoor stadium kicks off
byline: The construction of the first-ever Indoor Stadium in the Jaffna District officially commenced today under the patronage of Minister of Youth Affairs and Sports, Sunil Kumara Gamage.
